member.name: T:TeamControlium.Utilities.Detokenizer
member.summary: Processes given strings to process and resolve all tokens in passed strings.

member.name: F:TeamControlium.Utilities.Detokenizer.EscapeChar
member.summary: Character to use as an escape char.
member.remarks: Defined as a string incase it itself has to be escaped in the Regular Expression pattern

member.name: F:TeamControlium.Utilities.Detokenizer.StartTokenChar
member.summary: Character defining the start of a Token to be processed.
member.remarks: Must NOT be the same as the escape character. Is a string incase it needs to be escaped for Regular Expression pattern.

member.name: F:TeamControlium.Utilities.Detokenizer.EndTokenChar
member.summary: Character defining the end of a Token to be processed.
member.remarks: Must NOT be the same as the escape character or the start token character. Is a string incase it needs to be escaped for Regular Expression pattern.

member.name: F:TeamControlium.Utilities.Detokenizer.StartTokenPattern
member.summary: Regular Expression pattern defining the start of a Token to be processed.
member.remarks: Should contain a negative look-behind to enable escaping.

member.name: F:TeamControlium.Utilities.Detokenizer.EndTokenPattern
member.summary: Regular Expression pattern defining the end of a Token to be processed.
member.remarks: Should contain a negative look-behind to enable escaping.

member.name: F:TeamControlium.Utilities.Detokenizer.DefaultCommonDelimiter
member.summary: Default token delimiter. Delimiter is used to partition token verb and body and is the default for field partitions within a token body.

member.name: F:TeamControlium.Utilities.Detokenizer.threadDelimiters
member.summary: Collection of delimiters split by thread. Allows different threads to use different delimiters if required.

member.name: P:TeamControlium.Utilities.Detokenizer.CustomTokenProcessor
member.summary: Gets or sets delegate for processing custom tokens if required. If set, delegate is called before internal token processing to allow overriding if required.
member.remarks: Assigned delegate must take char (delimiter being used) and the token (split into an array using delimiter as separator) and return the resolved token text. If the token cannot be resolved, delegate should return a null. Any exception should be allowed to ripple up to enable the Utilities Detokenizer to handle the error.

member.name: P:TeamControlium.Utilities.Detokenizer.DefaultTokenDelimiterCurrentThread
member.summary: Gets or sets the default delimiter within tokens.
member.remarks: This is used as the delimiter when separating token verb from body and is the default token when token verb processors split their required fields. Is thread-safe; if a Thread changes the token delimiter the change only affects Detokenizer calls for that thread.

member.name: P:TeamControlium.Utilities.Detokenizer.RandomGenerator
member.summary: Gets initialized instance of the .NET Random generator. Used when resolving {random tokens.

member.name: M:TeamControlium.Utilities.Detokenizer.Detokenize(System.String)
member.summary: Process passed string and return after resolving all tokens.
member.param: String possibly containing tokens.
member.returns: Passed string with all valid tokens resolved.

member.name: M:TeamControlium.Utilities.Detokenizer.ProcessToken(System.String)
member.summary: Processes parses and processes passed in token and returns the resolution result. Token must be trimmed of its start/end indicators.
member.param: Token to be processed
member.returns: Result of processing passed in token.
member.remarks: A token must at least contain a single element, the verb. This tells the processor what processing is required to resolve the token. The total number of elements in the token depends on the verb. As an example the random token requires three fields (examples assume delimiter is a ;): verb;type;format or length. IE. "random;digits;5" returns 5 random digits. "random;date(01-01-1980,31-12-1980);dd MMM yy" returns a random 1980 date such as 09 JUN 80.

member.name: M:TeamControlium.Utilities.Detokenizer.DoRandomToken(System.String)
member.summary: Process a 'random' token and return result
member.param: Body part of token. Format depends on type of random being executed.
member.returns: Token resolution result

member.name: M:TeamControlium.Utilities.Detokenizer.DoDateToken(System.String)
member.summary: Process a 'date' token and return result.
member.param: Consists of date offset process and required output format.
member.returns: Required date in specified format.

member.name: M:TeamControlium.Utilities.Detokenizer.DoFinancialYearToken(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns formatted start or end date of financial year date passed in is within.
member.param: Date within required financial year and required return format.
True - returns date start of financial year, False - returns date end of financial year.
member.returns: Start or end date of financial year date is within.

member.name: M:TeamControlium.Utilities.Detokenizer.DoRandomFloat(System.String)
member.summary: Returns random floating point number on or between the minimum and maximum limits
member.param: Maximum and minimum limits of random selection.
member.returns: Random floating point number

member.name: M:TeamControlium.Utilities.Detokenizer.DoRandomFloat(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Returns random floating point number on or between the minimum and maximum limits
member.param: Minimum limit
Maximum limit
member.returns: Random floating point number

member.name: M:TeamControlium.Utilities.Detokenizer.DoRandomDate(System.String)
member.summary: Returns random date on or between the minimum and maximum limits
member.param: String containing minimum and maximum dates in required format
member.returns: Random dates between the two given dates, inclusive.

member.name: M:TeamControlium.Utilities.Detokenizer.DoRandomDate(System.DateTime,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Returns random date on or between the minimum and maximum limits
member.param: Minimum date of random selection
Maximum date of random selection
member.returns: Random dates between the two given dates, inclusive.

member.name: M:TeamControlium.Utilities.Detokenizer.DoRandomTFN
member.summary: Returns a valid random Australian TFN
member.returns: Random valid TFN

member.name: T:TeamControlium.Utilities.Detokenizer.InnermostToken
member.summary: Represents result of a Token search for a given string

member.name: F:TeamControlium.Utilities.Detokenizer.InnermostToken.tokenPreamble
member.summary: Holds all characters preceding any found token in given string. Holds ALL characters from given string if no token found.

member.name: F:TeamControlium.Utilities.Detokenizer.InnermostToken.tokenPostamble
member.summary: Holds all characters following found token in given string.

member.name: F:TeamControlium.Utilities.Detokenizer.InnermostToken.token
member.summary: Innermost token found in given string

member.name: F:TeamControlium.Utilities.Detokenizer.InnermostToken.foundToken
member.summary: Indicates if a token was found or not

member.name: M:TeamControlium.Utilities.Detokenizer.InnermostToken.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. Takes a string that may or may not contain token/s. If string contains token/s, innermost (from left) token is identified
member.param: String to be processed

member.name: P:TeamControlium.Utilities.Detokenizer.InnermostToken.Preamble
member.summary: Gets all characters preceding any found token in given string. Returns ALL characters from given string if no token found.

member.name: P:TeamControlium.Utilities.Detokenizer.InnermostToken.Postamble
member.summary: Gets all characters following found token in given string.

member.name: P:TeamControlium.Utilities.Detokenizer.InnermostToken.Token
member.summary: Gets Innermost token found in given string

member.name: P:TeamControlium.Utilities.Detokenizer.InnermostToken.HasToken
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether a token was found

member.name: T:TeamControlium.Utilities.Log
member.summary: Manages logging information. Created from scratch rather than using an OffTheShelf (NLog, Log4Net etc) to keep footprint as small as possible while ensuring logging is formatted, along with functionality, exactly as we want.

member.name: F:TeamControlium.Utilities.Log.testTimer
member.summary: Used to keep track of time since first call to Logger class made.

member.name: F:TeamControlium.Utilities.Log.testToolStrings
member.summary: Different threads will be sending logging information to Log. So, when building a Log string (IE. Calls to .DoWrite to build a Log string) the string relating to the correct thread is appended to.

member.name: F:TeamControlium.Utilities.Log.errorWrittenToEventLog
member.summary: Indicates whether an error has been written to the event log. Allows suppressing of further errors to prevent log blow-out.

member.name: F:TeamControlium.Utilities.Log.lockWriteLine
member.summary: Used for locking during a DoWriteLine. To ensure thread safety, only a single thread at a time is permitted to call DoWriteLine at any one time.

member.name: F:TeamControlium.Utilities.Log.lockWrite
member.summary: Used for locking during a DoWriteLine. To ensure thread safety, only a single thread at a time is permitted to call DoWrite at any one time.

member.name: M:TeamControlium.Utilities.Log.#cctor
member.summary: Initializes static members of the class. Instantiates an instant of the Log static class. Starts the main Stopwatch running for timing information in log data.

member.name: T:TeamControlium.Utilities.Log.LogLevels
member.summary:
Levels of logging - Verbose (Maximum) to Exception (Minimum). If level of text being written to logging is equal to, or higher than the current LoggingLevel the text is written.
This is used to filter logging so that only entries to log are made if the level of the write is equal or greater than the logging level set by LoggingLevel.

member.name: F:TeamControlium.Utilities.Log.LogLevels.FrameworkDebug
member.summary: Data written to log if LoggingLevel is FrameworkDebug and WriteLogException is FrameworkDebug or higher

member.name: F:TeamControlium.Utilities.Log.LogLevels.FrameworkInformation
member.summary: Data written to log if LoggingLevel is FrameworkInformation and WriteLogException is FrameworkInformation or higher

member.name: F:TeamControlium.Utilities.Log.LogLevels.TestDebug
member.summary: Data written to log if LoggingLevel is TestDebug and WriteLogException is TestDebug or higher

member.name: F:TeamControlium.Utilities.Log.LogLevels.TestInformation
member.summary: Data written to log if LoggingLevel is TestInformation and WriteLogException is TestInformation or Error

member.name: F:TeamControlium.Utilities.Log.LogLevels.Error
member.summary: Data always written to results

member.name: P:TeamControlium.Utilities.Log.CurrentLoggingLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets Logging level. Lowest is Error (least amount of log data written - only writes at level Error are written to the log). Most data is written to the log if level set is FrameworkDebug.
member.remarks: Default is FrameworkDebug

member.name: P:TeamControlium.Utilities.Log.WriteToConsole
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether log data is written to Console.
If true debug data is written to the Console (STDOUT)
If false and has been defined, no log data is written to Console. If has NOT been defined, WriteToConsole false is ignored and output is STILL written to Console.
member.remarks: The default is true (log data to be written to the console)

member.name: P:TeamControlium.Utilities.Log.TestToolLog
member.summary: Gets or sets delegate to write debug data to if WriteToConsole is false.
member.remarks: Note. If the delegate throws an exception, allow the exception to ripple up. Log class will handle the exception and write details to the OS event logging system.

member.name: M:TeamControlium.Utilities.Log.ResetTimer
member.summary: Resets the logger elapsed timer to zero

member.name: M:TeamControlium.Utilities.Log.WriteLogException(System.Exception)
member.summary: Writes details of a caught exception to the active debug log at level Error
member.remarks:
If current error logging level is FrameworkDebug the full exception is written, including stack-trace etc.
With any other Log Level only the exception message is written if an exception is thrown during write, Logger attempts to write the error details if able.
member.param: Exception being logged

member.name: M:TeamControlium.Utilities.Log.WriteLogException(System.Exception,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Writes details of a caught exception to the active debug log at level Error
member.remarks:
If current error logging level is FrameworkDebug the full exception is written, including stack trace details etc.
With any other Log Level only the exception message is written if an exception is thrown during write, Logger attempts to write the error details if able.
member.param: Exception being logged
Additional string format text to show when logging exception
Arguments shown in string format text

member.name: M:TeamControlium.Utilities.Log.WriteLog(TeamControlium.Utilities.Log.LogLevels,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Writes a line of data to the active debug log with no line termination
member.param: Level of text being written (See for usage of the Log Level)
Text to be written
String formatting arguments (if any)

member.name: M:TeamControlium.Utilities.Log.WriteLogLine(TeamControlium.Utilities.Log.LogLevels,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Writes a line of data to the active debug log. Data can be formatted in the standard string.format syntax. If an exception is thrown during write, Logger attempts to write the error details if able.
member.param: Level of text being written (See for usage of the Log Level)
Text to be written
String formatting arguments (if any)
member.example:
WriteLogException a line of data from our test:
Logger.WriteLogLine(LogLevels.TestDebug, "Select member using key (Member: {0})","90986754332");
member.remarks: If arguments are passed in but there is an error formatting the text line during resolution of the arguments they will be ignored and the text line written out without arguments.

member.name: M:TeamControlium.Utilities.Log.WriteTextToFile(System.String,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Writes given Text to a text file, optionally auto versioning (adding (n) to filename) OR overwriting.
member.remarks: No exception is raised if there is any problem, but details of error is written to Logger log
member.param: Full path and filename to use
If true and file exists. (n) is added to auto-version. If false and file exists, it is overwritten if able
Text to write

member.name: M:TeamControlium.Utilities.Log.WriteLogException(System.Diagnostics.StackFrame,System.Exception,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Does writing of the logged exception
member.param: Stack frame passed in by caller. Used to get method base details
Exception being reported
Optional text
Optional text arguments

member.name: M:TeamControlium.Utilities.Log.CallingMethodDetails(System.Reflection.MethodBase)
member.summary: Gets class-type and Method name of passed MethodBase class.
member.param: MethodBase of class
member.returns: Formatted string containing Type.Method

member.name: M:TeamControlium.Utilities.Log.DoWrite(System.Reflection.MethodBase,TeamControlium.Utilities.Log.LogLevels,System.String)
member.summary: Appends text to currently active line. If the start of line, text is pre-pended with Line header information
member.param: MethodBase of class calling Logger class
Level of debug text to be written
Text string to be written
member.remarks: Text is written if TypeOfWrite is equal to, or higher the current Logging Level

member.name: M:TeamControlium.Utilities.Log.DoWriteLine(System.Reflection.MethodBase,TeamControlium.Utilities.Log.LogLevels,System.String)
member.summary: Appends text to currently active line and writes line to active log. If new line, text is pre-pended with Line header information
member.param: MethodBase of class calling Logger class
Level of debug text to be written
Text string to be written
member.remarks: Text is written if TypeOfWrite is equal to, or higher the current Logging Level

member.name: M:TeamControlium.Utilities.Log.GetPreAmble(System.Reflection.MethodBase,TeamControlium.Utilities.Log.LogLevels)
member.summary: Constructs and returns a log-file pre-amble. Preamble is {Log Type} - [{Time}][{Elapsed}] [Calling Type.Method]:
member.param: Reference to calling method
Type of write
member.returns: Line pre-amble text

member.name: M:TeamControlium.Utilities.Log.GetWriteTypeString(TeamControlium.Utilities.Log.LogLevels)
member.summary: Returns debug line initial token based on LogLevel of text being written
member.param: Log Level to obtain text for
member.returns: Textual representation for Debug log line pre-amble

member.name: T:TeamControlium.Utilities.Repository
member.summary: Central Test Data repository for tool independent storage of data used within tests. TeamControlium repository is intended to be used as the primary mechanism for storage of data within a Test Framework and is used for configuration settings of the Controlium based library. It is a thread-safe static repository with dynamic objects that can be scoped for global (all threads) or local (local thread only visibility) use but with the ability to clone data from Global to Local if/as required.

member.name: F:TeamControlium.Utilities.Repository.repository
member.summary: Actual storage of data. Three dimensional dictionary. Dimension 1 is the ThreadID storing data for the identified specific thread. Dimension 2 is the data categoryName Dimension 3 is the data item name Data is stored as dynamic objects enabling storage of anything and runtime changes of item location types as well as varying types in the repository.

member.name: F:TeamControlium.Utilities.Repository.globalIndex
member.summary: When data is stored in the Global repository (IE. Seen by all threads) the threadID used is -1.

member.name: F:TeamControlium.Utilities.Repository.categorylessItems
member.summary: Repository allows test code to store data singly or in Categories. If storing a data item without a Category, it actually goes in the categoryName named in this variable.
member.remarks: There is the chance a test framework could create a categoryName with the same name. However, this a low risk and could always be changed at a later date if needed.

member.name: F:TeamControlium.Utilities.Repository.lastException
member.summary: Stores the last exception/s caught when using Try... methods. Is in a dictionary to enable thread-safe and thread oriented exception storage. A thread can ONLY see the last exception thrown for it's specific thread. The ensures maximum flexibility in parallel testing scenarios.

member.name: P:TeamControlium.Utilities.Repository.ItemLocal
member.summary: Gets reference to the Dynamic items class allowing indexed access to and setting of all Local stored data items in current thread.
member.remarks: This is a reference to an indexer class. So can be used as an indexed property. All data stored in the Local repository are visible only to code executing within the current thread.
member.example: Example stores string 'some data' in the repository, naming it 'MyItem'. Then recalls Repository item 'MyItem', storing it in myData. Repository.ItemLocal["MyItem"] = "some data"; string myData = Repository.ItemLocal["MyItem"]; // myData now equal to 'some data'

member.name: P:TeamControlium.Utilities.Repository.ItemGlobal
member.summary: Gets reference to the Dynamic items class allowing indexed access to and setting of all Globally stored data items.
member.remarks: This is a reference to an indexer class. So can be used as an indexed property. All data stored in the Global repository are visible across all threads.
member.example: Example stores string 'some data' in the repository, naming it 'MyItem'. Then recalls Repository item 'MyItem', storing it in myData. Repository.ItemGlobal["MyItem"] = "some data"; string myData = Repository.ItemGlobal["MyItem"]; // myData now equal to 'some data'

member.name: M:TeamControlium.Utilities.Repository.RepositoryLastTryException
member.summary: Returns the last exception were a TryGetRunCategoryOptions returned false
member.returns: Last exception thrown by a Try... method in this thread.
member.remarks: Return is cast as Exception but underlying type can be obtained by called (IE. var myType = Repository.RepositoryLastTryException().GetType();

member.name: M:TeamControlium.Utilities.Repository.HasCategoryLocal(System.String)
member.summary: Indicates whether Local repository has a Category with the given name
member.param: Name of category to check for.
member.returns: True if local repository has category named. Otherwise False.

member.name: M:TeamControlium.Utilities.Repository.HasCategoryGlobal(System.String)
member.summary: Indicates whether Global repository has a Category with the given name
member.param: Name of category to check for.
member.returns: True if global repository has category named. Otherwise False.

member.name: M:TeamControlium.Utilities.Repository.GetCategoryLocal(System.String)
member.summary: Returns all items (in dictionary) from required local category
member.param: Name of category to retrieve items from
member.returns: All items from Local repository in named Category.

member.name: M:TeamControlium.Utilities.Repository.GetCategoryGlobal(System.String)
member.summary: Returns all items (in dictionary) from required global category
member.param: Name of category to retrieve items from
member.returns: All items from Global repository in named Category.

member.name: M:TeamControlium.Utilities.Repository.TryGetCategoryLocal(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.Object}@)
member.summary: Gets all items (in dictionary) from required local category indicating success or failure of retrieval
member.param: Name of category to retrieve items from
Output parameter populated with all items in named local category if successful. Null reference if not
member.returns: True if Category exists and item/s retrieved successfully. False if not.
member.remarks: If method fails and returns False, can be used to obtain exception thrown.

member.name: M:TeamControlium.Utilities.Repository.TryGetCategoryGlobal(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.Object}@)
member.summary: Gets all items (in dictionary) from required global category indicating success or failure of retrieval
member.param: Name of category to retrieve items from
Output parameter populated with all items in named global category if successful. Null reference if not
member.returns: True if Category exists and item/s retrieved successfully. False if not.
member.remarks: If method fails and returns False, can be used to obtain exception thrown.

member.name: M:TeamControlium.Utilities.Repository.SetCategoryLocal(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.Object},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Load named Local repository category with required data.
member.remarks: If category already exists, merge data optionally overwriting if duplicate keys found.
member.param: Name of category to add or merge in
Category data to add or merge in
If true, any existing data items are overwritten. Otherwise any duplicates will result in an Exception.

member.name: M:TeamControlium.Utilities.Repository.SetCategoryGlobal(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.Object},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Load named Global repository category with required data.
member.remarks: If category already exists, merge data optionally overwriting if duplicate keys found.
member.param: Name of category to add or merge in
Category data to add or merge in
If true, any existing data items are overwritten. Otherwise any duplicates will result in an Exception.

member.summary: Returns non-categorized data item from local repository.
member.param: Name of data item to retrieve
member.remarks: If item does not exist or there is a error obtaining item an exception will be thrown
member.returns: Data item. Type is dynamic so it is callers responsibility to ensure correct typing (Use for type checked data recall.

member.remarks: If item does not exist or there is a error obtaining item an exception will be thrown

member.name: M:TeamControlium.Utilities.Repository.TryGetItemGlobal``1(System.String,System.String,``0@)
member.summary: Returns categorized data item from global repository with verification of required type indicating if successful or not
member.param: Name of category to retreive data item from
Name of data item to retrieve
Item found (if succesful) or null. Type checked with expected type to ensure type compatibility.
member.returns: True if sucessful, False if not or type differs to expected.
member.remarks: If method fails and returns False, can be used to obtain exception thrown.

member.name: M:TeamControlium.Utilities.Repository.GetItemOrDefaultLocal``1(System.String)
member.summary: Returns non-categorized data item from local repository with verification of required type or types default value if item does not exist
member.param: Name of data item to retrieve
member.remarks: If item does not exist, the default value for the Type defied in the call will be returned.
member.returns: Data item or default value based on Type. Type will be cast as required.

member.param: Name of data item to retrieve
member.remarks: If item does not exist, the default value for the Type defied in the call will be returned.
member.returns: Data item or default value based on Type. Type will be cast as required.

member.param: Name of Category data item is in
Name of data item to retrieve
member.remarks: If item does not exist, the default value for the Type defied in the call will be returned.
member.returns: Data item or default value based on Type. Type will be cast as required.

member.name: M:TeamControlium.Utilities.Repository.SetItemLocal(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Stores data item in local repository with defined non-categorized name
member.param: Label to store data item with
Data item to store
member.remarks: If data item already exists it is overwritten with current data

member.summary: Stores data item in global repository with defined non-categorized name
member.param: Label to store data item with

member.remarks: If data item already exists it is overwritten with current data

member.name: M:TeamControlium.Utilities.Repository.SetItemLocal(System.String,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Stores data item in local repository with defined categorized name
member.param: Name of category to store data item in
Label to store data item with
Data item to store
member.remarks: If category does not exist it is created. If data item already exists it is overwritten with current data.

member.name: M:TeamControlium.Utilities.Repository.SetItemGlobal(System.String,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Stores data item in global repository with defined categorized name
member.param: Name of category to store data item in
Label to store data item with
Data item to store
member.remarks: If category does not exist it is created. If data item already exists it is overwritten with current data.

member.name: M:TeamControlium.Utilities.Repository.CloneLocalToGlobal(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Copy all data from Local to Global repository.
member.param: Indicates if existing data should be overwritten. An exception is thrown if false and any existing item/s would be overwritten.
member.remarks: A deep clone is performed to copy items. However, it should be noted that complex data items (EG. IO refeferences etc) may clone incorrectly. Complex type cloning should be verified during test framework development to ensure correct cloning.

member.name: M:TeamControlium.Utilities.Repository.CloneCategoryLocalToGlobal(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Copy all data from required Local category to Global repository.
member.param: Name of category to be copied.
Indicates if existing data should be overwritten. An exception is thrown if false and any existing item/s would be overwritten.
member.remarks: A deep clone is performed to copy items. However, it should be noted that complex data items (EG. IO refeferences etc) may clone incorrectly. Complex type cloning should be verified during test framework development to ensure correct cloning.

member.name: M:TeamControlium.Utilities.Repository.CloneItemLocalToGlobal(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Copy named data item from required Local category to Global repository.
member.param: Name of category to be copied.
Name of item to clone.
Indicates if existing data item should be overwritten if it already exists. An exception is thrown if false and the named data item exists in global repository.
member.remarks: A deep clone is performed to copy items. However, it should be noted that complex data items (EG. IO refeferences etc) may clone incorrectly. Complex type cloning should be verified during test framework development to ensure correct cloning.

member.name: M:TeamControlium.Utilities.Repository.TryCloneLocalToGlobal(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Copy all data from Local to Global repository indicting if successful or not.
member.param: Indicates if existing data should be overwritten. An exception is thrown if false and any existing item/s would be overwritten.
member.returns: True if successful clone or false if not (See for exception thrown if false returned).
member.remarks: A deep clone is performed to copy items. However, it should be noted that complex data items (EG. IO refeferences etc) may clone incorrectly. Complex type cloning should be verified during test framework development to ensure correct cloning.

member.remarks: A deep clone is performed to copy items. However, it should be noted that complex data items (EG. IO refeferences etc) may clone incorrectly. Complex type cloning should be verified during test framework development to ensure correct cloning.

member.name: M:TeamControlium.Utilities.Repository.ClearRepositoryAll
member.summary: Clear data from Global and all thread repositories
member.remarks: Should be used carefully as ALL data from Global and local repositories is removed. Many TeamControlium libraries use Repository data to hold configuration settings and defaults. If used after clearing repository these will not be available and errors may be thrown.

member.name: M:TeamControlium.Utilities.Repository.ClearRepositoryLocal
member.summary: Clear data from Local repository
member.remarks: Should be used carefully as ALL data from the local repository is removed. Many TeamControlium libraries use the local thread's repository to hold configuration data. If this is cleared it should be rebuilt if required to ensure errors are not thrown.

member.name: M:TeamControlium.Utilities.Repository.ClearRepositoryGlobal
member.summary: Clear data from Global repository

member.name: M:TeamControlium.Utilities.Repository.SetLastException``1(``0)
member.summary: Called to store exception information when a Try... method catches an Exception. Allows actual exception type to be stored so that reader can determine underlying exception type.
member.param: Exception to be stored

member.name: M:TeamControlium.Utilities.Repository.getCategory(System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves Dictionary, containing all data items for the named category, from the Local or Global repository
member.param: Indicates if local repository should be used (true) or global (false)
Name of category to obtain
member.returns: Dictionary of data items in required repository's named category
member.remarks: Method is NOT thread safe. It is the responsibility of the calling code to ensure thread safety. If category does not exist or there is another issue retrieving the category an exception will be thrown.

member.param: Indicates if local repository should be used (true) or global (false)
Name of category being added
Dictionary to add
Flag stating if existing data items can be overwritten.
member.remarks: If the named category is false and the repository category already exists with
